ans.reasoning: The method 'callRealMethod' attempts to invoke a real method on a mock object. If the method does not exist on the mock, it will lead to a NoSuchMethodError, which is the error observed in the test. This makes it highly suspicious.

This method also invokes a real method on a target object and includes error handling. The fact that it catches exceptions and filters them suggests it is involved in the method invocation process, making it suspicious as well.
This method invokes a super method on a target object. If the super method does not exist, it could lead to similar issues as seen in the test. Its role in method invocation makes it suspicious.
Similar to method_id 1, this method invokes a super method but does not have additional error handling. It is still suspicious due to its role in method invocation.
This method registers an answer for a mock invocation. While it is part of the mocking process, it does not directly invoke methods, making it less suspicious than the previous methods.
This method is responsible for setting up stubbing for method calls. It is part of the mocking framework but does not directly invoke methods, making it less suspicious.
This method adds an answer to a mock but does not directly deal with method invocation. It is the least suspicious as it does not contribute to the invocation process that led to the error.
